title: Social Media Manager / Content Creator Job at Vantegral Consulting
content:
Vantegral Consulting - We are a dynamic recruitment and consulting firm committed to connecting top talent with the right opportunities. Our mission is to help businesses streamline their hiring processes while supporting job seekers in achieving their career goals. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager / Content Creator

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are currently seeking a creative and strategic Social Media Manager with strong content creation skills to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will help enhance our digital presence, engage our audience, and position our brand as a leading voice in the HR and recruitment industry.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a comprehensive social media strategy aligned with business objectives.
	Manage and grow the company’s presence across platforms, including LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter (X), Facebook, and TikTok.
	Create, curate, and schedule high-quality, engaging content (text, images, videos, reels, infographics) tailored to each platform.
	Use analytics tools to track and report performance, adjusting strategies for optimal results.
	Manage paid social advertising campaigns on platforms such as LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram.
	Monitor social and industry trends; implement innovative campaigns to increase brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation.
	Collaborate with the recruitment team to promote job openings, employer branding content, and career development tips.
	Engage actively with followers, respond to comments and inquiries, and build a strong online community.
	Stay updated on platform algorithm changes, digital trends, and best practices to maintain a competitive edge.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
	2 – 3 years of proven experience as a Social Media Manager or in a similar role, preferably in recruitment, HR, or consulting.
	Strong content creation skills including experience with graphic design, short-form video editing, and storytelling.
	Proficiency in tools such as Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar content creation platforms.
	Solid understanding of SEO, paid social advertising, and analytics (e.g., Google Analytics, Meta Business Suite, LinkedIn Analytics).
	Excellent copywriting and verbal communication skills.
	Strong attention to detail, creativity, and ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.


Why Join Us?


	Salary: N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly (Other benefits excluded)
	Work in a fast-growing recruitment and consulting firm with strong industry impact.
	Shape the digital voice and employer brand of a reputable HR consultancy.
	Collaborative team environment with room for growth and learning.

title: Executive Assistant to the MD / CEO Job at Private Sector Health Alliance of Nigeria
keyword: private sector health alliance of nigeria
content:
At Private Sector Health Alliance of Nigeria (PSHAN), we create a compelling opportunity to pool private sector capabilities to improve Healthcare systems in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the MD / CEO
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant (EA) to support our MD/CEO in the NGO sector.
	As a crucial member of the team, you will play an essential role in ensuring the seamless functioning of the executive office while contributing to organizational success.


Responsibilities


	Manage the executive’s calendar, scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Anticipate and prioritize the needs of the MD/CEO, acting as a proactive and trusted assistant.
	Prepare, collate and manage reports, minutes of meetings, etc
	Handle email and phone inquiries, efficiently screening calls and messages.
	Organize and maintain both physical and digital executive filing systems.
	Coordinate logistics for meetings, conferences, and events.
	Perform other ad-hoc tasks as assigned.


Qualifications


	Minimum of 3 years of experience in an Executive Assistant or similar administrative role.
	Strong organisational skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.
	High degree of discretion, professionalism, and integrity.
	Ability to work independently, take initiative, and maintain confidentiality.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to liaise with executives and staff at all levels.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant tools.
	Keen attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrsupport@pshan.org using "Executive Assistant" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only Lagos state-based candidates will be contacted.

title: Procurement Officer Job at JIJEDAPT Human Resources Consult Limited
content:
JIJEDAPT Human Resources Consult Limited is involved in the Consultancy Of Human Resources Management And Services, Project Management, Training And Certifications, Business Plans, Business Optimization, Expatriate Management, Information Management Sysyem and GeneralAdvisory Services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Agadagba-Obon, Ese-Odo LGA, Ondo 
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Procurement Manager/General Manager

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced Procurement Officer to source, negotiate, and purchase goods and services that meet our organization's needs.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for developing procurement strategies, managing supplier relationships, and ensuring compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities
Sourcing and Procurement:


	Identify reliable suppliers and negotiate pricing, terms, and contracts
	Conduct market research to identify potential suppliers and analyze their capabilities
	Evaluate and approve purchase requests, ensuring adherence to company policies and budgetary constraints.


Supplier Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers
	Negotiate contracts and ensure compliance with contractual terms
	Monitor supplier performance and resolve any issues or disputes.


Inventory and Stock Management:


	Manage inventory levels and ensure timely delivery of goods and services
	Monitor and track purchase orders to ensure accuracy and completeness.


Compliance and Documentation:


	Ensure procurement activities adhere to company policies and regulatory requirements
	Maintain accurate records of purchases, contracts, and supplier evaluations
	Conduct audits to ensure transparency and compliance.


Requirements and Qualifications
Education:


	Bachelor's Degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.


Experience:


	2-5 years of experience in procurement or a related field.


Skills:


	Excellent negotiation, communication, and analytical skills
	Proficiency in procurement software and tools
	Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask
	Ability to work effectively with suppliers, stakeholders, and team members.


Certifications:


	Professional certifications like CIPS or CPSM are an added advantage.


What We Offer


	Salary: N150,000 - N250,000 / month. 
	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunity to work with a dynamic and growing organization
	Collaborative and supportive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jijedapthrconsulting@gmail.com using "Procurement Officer" as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Lisse Africa
content:
Lisse Africa is a dynamic human resource consulting firm with key interest in recruitment with the aim of providing employees that are professional, verified and with a good cultural fit. At Lisse Africa, our aim is to build the world's most valued Recruitment Solution Company to Clients, Candidates, Colleagues and the communities where we work and live with regards to staff recruitment, background verification and other HR solutions.

We solely focus on the enhancement of client organizations by providing quality services on various aspects of their human resources and by letting the organization focus on its core issues.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Content Creator
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Osapa, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Hybrid ( 3 days in the office and 2 days work from home)

Role Description


	The Content Creator will be responsible for generating engaging and relevant content for the brand, including product descriptions, blog posts, social media posts, and marketing materials.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or related field with at least 2 years of work experience.
	Content Creation, Copywriting, and Blogging skills
	Social Media Management and Marketing skills
	Knowledge of SEO and digital marketing strategies
	Excellent communication and storytelling abilities
	Experience with eCommerce platforms is a plus.


Salary
N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using "Content Creator"as the subject of the mail .

 

2.) Male Housekeeper

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Accommodation: Yes

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dedicated cleaner/housekeeper to maintain cleanliness and organisation in a residential setting.
	Responsibilities include performing routine cleaning tasks, such as dusting, vacuuming, mopping floors, and sanitising bathrooms and kitchen areas.
	The ideal candidate should demonstrate attention to detail, reliability, and the ability to work independently.
	Previous experience in cleaning or housekeeping roles is preferred.
	This position offers an opportunity to contribute to creating a comfortable and hygienic environment for residents.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an SSCE qualification
	Minimum of 2 years of professional housekeeping experience.
	Physical ability to stand for extended periods, bend, lift, push, and move objects.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using "Male House Keeper" as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Cleaner

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Part-time
Work Mode: 3 times a week

Key Responsibilities


	Clean and maintain rooms, floors, and surfaces.
	Empty trash and recyclables.
	Restock supplies and materials.
	Perform other cleaning tasks as needed.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess SSCE with 1 - 3 years of experience.
	Ability to lift and move heavy objects.
	Attention to detail and ability to follow instructions.
	Reliable and punctual.
	Availability to attend work 2 times per week.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using "Cleaner" as the subject of the email.

title: Warehouse Supervisor Job at GUO Transport Company
content:
GUO Transport Company is a division of G. U. Okeke & Sons Limited, a household name in the transportation industry and one of the largest providers of intercity and interstate transportation, serving more than 200 destinations across Nigeria and West Africa with a modern and environmentally friendly fleet.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor
Job Location: Orile Coker, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Supervise warehouse staff and manage day-to-day warehouse operations.
	Ensure accurate inventory control and timely stock reconciliation.
	Optimize warehouse layout and workflow for efficiency
	Monitor the receipt, storage, and dispatch of goods.
	Implement and maintain safety and dispatch of goods.
	Generate regular inventory and activity reports for management.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements.


Technical & Professional Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in logistics, supply chain management, business administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in warehouse operations or a similar supervisory role.
	Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills.
	Proficiency in inventory management systems and Microsoft Excel.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Knowledge of safety and regulatory standards related to warehousing.


Perks & Benefits


	Salary: N150,000 - N250,000 Monthly. 
	Staff Bus to commute to work daily
	Free Travel ticket across Nigeria and West Africa
	HMO
